Package io.wcm.caravan.rhyme.api

Interface Rhyme

  • @ProviderType
public interface Rhyme
    A facade interface that simplifies all interaction with the core framework to handle an incoming request for a HAL+JSON resource. You should create a Rhyme instance immediately after accepting an incoming request (using a RhymeBuilder) and then use this single instance to fetch all upstream resource and render the response.

    If you are only using the Rhyme framework as a HAL client library (but not to render HAL resources) then you can use HalApiClient directly.

    See Also:
    RhymeBuilder

    • Method Detail

      • getRemoteResource

        <T> T getRemoteResource​(String uri,
                        Class<T> halApiInterface)
        Create a dynamic client proxy to load and navigate through HAL+JSON resources from an upstream service. Any interaction with the proxies will be recorded and used to generate embedded metadata about the upstream requests when renderResponse(LinkableResource) is called later.
        Type Parameters:
        T - an interface annotated with HalApiInterface
        Parameters:
        uri - the URI of the entry point, in any format that the HalResourceLoader being used can understand
        halApiInterface - an interface annotated with HalApiInterface
        Returns:
        a dynamic proxy instance of the provided interface that you can use to navigate through the resources of the service
        See Also:
        HalApiClient

      • setResponseMaxAge

        void setResponseMaxAge​(Duration duration)
        Limit the maximum time for which the response should be cached by clients and downstream services. Note that calling this method only sets the upper limit: if other upstream resource fetched during the current request indicate a lower max-age value in their header, that lower value will be used instead.
        Parameters:
        duration - the max cache time

      • renderResponse

        io.reactivex.rxjava3.core.Single<HalResponse> renderResponse​(io.wcm.caravan.rhyme.api.resources.LinkableResource resourceImpl)
        Asynchronously render the given resource as a HalResponse instance. If rendering is successful, that instance will have a 200 status code and a HAL+JSON media type. If any errors were thrown and handled, a vnd.error response will be rendered instead (using the status code obtained from the ExceptionStatusAndLoggingStrategy)
        Parameters:
        resourceImpl - a server-side implementation of an interface annotated with HalApiInterface
        Returns:
        a Single that will emit a HalResponse instance with status code, content type and body already set

      • renderVndErrorResponse

        HalResponse renderVndErrorResponse​(Throwable error)
        Render a vnd.error response for an error that happened before the LinkableResource instance was created (using the status code obtained from the ExceptionStatusAndLoggingStrategy).
        Parameters:
        error - an exception that was caught during initialisation
        Returns:
        a HalResponse instance with status code, content type and body already set

      • startStopwatch

        RequestMetricsStopwatch startStopwatch​(Class measuringClass,
                                       Supplier<String> taskDescription)
        Start measuring the execution time of a specific (possibly repeated) task within your own code. To finish the measurement, you have to call RequestMetricsStopwatch.close() when the task has been completed, or use a try-with-resources statement around the code section to be measured (since it's an AutoCloseable type). The result of your measurements will appear within the embedded "rhyme:metadata" resource in the rendered response.
        Parameters:
        measuringClass - only used to group the results in the "rhyme:metadata" resource into separate sections for each class
        taskDescription - provides a human readable description of the task (and context) that was executed. Measurements with the exact same task descriptions will be grouped, and the execution count and overall sum of execution times will be calculated
        Returns:
        a RequestMetricsStopwatch that you need to close to finish the measurement
